    • Constructor Detail

      • GameInstance

        public GameInstance()
        Default constructor. Creates a blank game by default.

      • GameInstance

        public GameInstance(Config config)
        Constructor with specifying a Config. This will create a new game as per the configuration of the specified Config object.
        Parameters:
        config - The configuration to use to create the new game.

        Parameters:

      • assignOneSetOfTilesToPlayers

        public void assignOneSetOfTilesToPlayers()
        Method to assign a new random tile to a player. This is done on the beginning of a new game.

      • giveFirstSetOfCoinsToPlayers

        private void giveFirstSetOfCoinsToPlayers()
        Method to give a set of coins to players at the beginning of the game. As of build 1 - initially every player is given a gold coin of 50 points.

      • getPlayerIndexByColor

        public int getPlayerIndexByColor(GameInstance.PlayerColor color)
        This method gets the index of a player by color.
        Parameters:
        color - The color of the player we are looking for.
        Returns:
        The index of the player with the specified color if found - otherwise returns -1 if not found.

      • notifyListeners

        private void notifyListeners(Object object,
                   String property,
                   int oldValue,
                   int newValue)
        Notifies the observer of a specified observable property change.
        Parameters:
        object - The object being observed - in this case it's the GameInstance.
        property - The property that has changed.
        oldValue - The value of the property before change.
        newValue - The value of the property after change.

      • addChangeListener

        public void addChangeListener(PropertyChangeListener newListener)
        Adds a change listener to the list of listeners.
        Parameters:
        newListener - The new change listener to add.

      • isGameEnded

        public boolean isGameEnded()
        Checks if a game has ended by checking a status variable.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the game has ended - else returns false.

      • setGameEnded

        public void setGameEnded(boolean newStatus)
        Sets the game ended status of the game.
        Parameters:
        newStatus - The new status of the game. true means game has ended - false means game has not ended.
